cause.description:
“Prohibition is an attempted cure that makes matters worse -- for both the addict and the rest of us.” - Milton Friedman
“If people let government decide what foods they eat and what medicines they take, their bodies will soon be in as sorry a state as are the souls of those who live under tyranny.” - Thomas Jefferson
“Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world; indeed, it's the only thing that ever does” - Margaret Mead
1. Liberalizing Cannabis laws is unlikely to lead to increased Cannabis use
2. Cannabis use does not lead to the commission of crime
3. Scientific evidence overwhelmingly indicates that Cannabis is substantially less harmful than alcohol
4. The money and services incurred, ie police and legal process, are just not worth it; additionally it provides an avenue for abuse.
5. It is estimated that methane and methanol production alone from hemp grown as biomass could replace 90% of the worlds energy needs.
6. Personal possesion and use should be decriminlized.
cause.mission: Promote intelligent debate and support for the decriminalization of Cannabis in South Africa
cause.name: Decriminalize Cannabis in South Africa
